The diagnosis of a reaction following a hymenoptera sting is based on :

- history

o identification of the insect by the subject, whether or not there is still a stinger in place

o type of reaction and chronology of symptoms.

- skin tests: intradermal tests (IDR) (''no prick'')

- biological tests: venom-specific IgE assay

properties.question: What are the key stages in the diagnosis of allergies to hymenoptera venoms?
properties.option_a: Blood pressure measurement and chest X-ray
properties.option_b: History taking, skin tests (IDR), and biological tests (venom-specific IgE assay)
properties.option_c: Complete blood count and liver function tests
